member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptionsHelper
member.summary: Utility class used to validate enumeration values./>

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions
member.summary: Defines the set of HTTP response cache control options that can be used with the HTTP Cache-Control header field for an . This is used by the to define which HTTP caching response headers to use if no HTTP caching response headers have been set on an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.None
member.summary: Don't include any cache control directives.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.NoCache
member.summary: The "no-cache" response directive indicates that the response MUST NOT be used to satisfy a subsequent request without successful validation on the origin server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.NoStore
member.summary: The "no-store" response directive indicates that a cache MUST NOT store any part of either the immediate request or response. This directive applies to both private and shared caches.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.MustRevalidate
member.summary: The "must-revalidate" response directive indicates that once it has become stale, a cache MUST NOT use the response to satisfy subsequent requests without successful validation on the origin server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.ProxyRevalidate
member.summary: The "proxy-revalidate" response directive has the same meaning as the must-revalidate response directive, except that it does not apply to private caches.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.NoTransform
member.summary: The "no-transform" response directive indicates that an intermediary (regardless of whether it implements a cache) MUST NOT transform the payload.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.Private
member.summary: The "private" response directive indicates that the response message is intended for a single user and MUST NOT be stored by a shared cache. A private cache MAY store the response and reuse it for later requests, even if the response would normally be non-cacheable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CacheOptions.Public
member.summary: The "public" response directive indicates that any cache MAY store the response, even if the response would normally be non-cacheable or cacheable only within a private cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicy
member.summary: Defines a cache policy describing which HTTP cache response headers to include in an . The is used by the which defines a default caching policy if no HTTP caching headers have been applied to a given .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicy.Options
member.summary: Gets or sets the to include with the Cache-Control HTTP header field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicy.MaxAge
member.summary: Gets or sets the timespan after which the response no longer can be considered fresh. If set then include a Cache-Control header field with a Max-Age property set to the value. For backwards compatibility with HTTP/1.0 caches, the Expires header field is also set to an equivalent absolute time stamp.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicyProvider
member.summary: Default implementation of with a set of possible default HTTP caching policies. If no HTTP caching headers have been set on a response then this abstraction is called allowing for a default set of HTTP caching headers to be applied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicyProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a default .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicyProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given .
member.param: The to use if no HTTP caching response headers have been set on an .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicyProvider.Policy
member.summary: Gets the being applied if no HTTP caching response headers have been set on an .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicyProvider.SetCacheOptions(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Applies the options to the given .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicyProvider.SetMaxAge(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Applies the MaxAge value to the given .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.CachePolicyProvider.ForceNoCache(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: For backwards compatibility with HTTP/1.0 caches, set the Expires header and Pragma headers to force no cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.ICachePolicyProvider
member.summary: Provides an abstraction for adding default HTTP caching headers to a given . If no HTTP caching headers have been set on a response then this abstraction is called allowing for a default set of HTTP caching headers to be applied. By default, the implementation is registered with the dependency injection engine but other implementations can be registered as well. If no is registered then no default caching headers will be added to an .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Cache.ICachePolicyProvider.SetCachePolicy(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Applies the default caching header policy to a given .

member.name: T:System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessageExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for providing various utilities.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessageExtensions.GetHeaderOrDefault(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the first HTTP header value as a single value or null if not present.
member.param: The request for where to look for the header.
member.returns: The first HTTP header value or null if not present.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessageExtensions.IsIfNoneMatch(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Net.Http.Headers.EntityTagHeaderValue)
member.summary: Checks if the request is conditional having a If-None-Match HTTP header field with a value that matches the value. In the case of true this can be used to indicate that a 304 (Not Modified) or a 412 (Precondition Failed) status code should be used.
member.param: The current etag for the resource. If there is no current etag (i.e. the resource does not yet exist) then use null.
member.returns: Returns true if one of the If-None-Match values match the current etag; or the If-None-Match value is "*" and is not null; otherwise false.
